DataElement.preferredName: Cervical Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cervical cancer based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic N stage of a cervical tumor (or cancer of the uterine cervix).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/10/17 tt Transferred ownership/BC and changed Reg Status.   Updated to use Property based on NCIt concepts

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cervical Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with no regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pNX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pNX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pNX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
